body.p:
OFFICIAL.
ASSESSOR'S OFFICE,
United States Internal Revenue,
Second District of Kentucky,
Lebanon, Ky., 2nd Septr 1865
Dear Govenor,

I desire very much to have Mr. E. C. Webb of this place appointed a Notary Public for Marion County. Mr Webb is a clerk in my office & it being absolutely necessary for the prosecution of my work that I have a Notary constantly at hand for the discharge of certain duties, it is not desired that he interfere with the business of any other Notary, but simply to administer such oaths & make such protests as are necessary for our office. If you will confer upon ^me^ this favour I shall feel under great obligation to you.

I am Governor very truly
Your obdt Servt.
W. M. Spencer
U. S. Assessor
2nd Dist Ky.

His Excellency
Governor Tho. E. Bramlette
Frankfort, Ky

Notary Public
Marion Co
E. C. Webb
apptd 4 Sept/65
